conclusion: Determine the change in the range of light incident on the central point at the bottom of the hole after embedding the glass brick.
Compare the angles before and after the glass brick is embedded.
Diameter of the hole is 40 cm, radius is 20 cm, thickness of the glass brick is 20√3 cm, refractive index of the glass is √3.
Calculate the critical angle using sin θc = 1/n = 1/√3, θc ≈ 35.26°.
Determine the angle of incidence before embedding the glass brick using tan θ1 = r/d = 1/√3, θ1 = 30°.
Determine the angle of incidence after embedding the glass brick using Snell's Law, θ2 ≈ 16.12°.
Calculate the new angle of incidence at the bottom, θ3 = 90° - θ2 ≈ 73.88°.
Determine the increase in the range of light, Δθ = θ3 - θ1 = 43.88°.
The range of light incident on the central point at the bottom of the hole is increased by approximately 43.88 degrees.
